intro: Gardenia armata, commonly known as the African evergreen or African gardenia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical Africa and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and fragrant white flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its flowers are often used in traditional medicine and as ornamental plants due to their beauty and scent. Gardenia armata prefers well-drained soil and partial shade, making it suitable for cultivation in warm, humid climates.
